sentences.en: A talented artist, he was, moreover, a writer of some note.
sentences.cn: 他是一位有才华的艺术家，同时也是颇有名气的作家。

sentences.en: Ade is regarded as a talented youth.
sentences.cn: 艾德被认为是个有才能的青年.

sentences.en: But that's the trouble with young people, no matter how talented.
sentences.cn: 他们必须明白,我也不是好惹的, 要制服我可也不那么容易.

sentences.en: For every one or two talented people in any group of artists, there are hordes of talentless hangers-on.
sentences.cn: 在任何一群艺术家中，每一两个有才华的人周围总有一帮平庸无能的溜须拍马者。

sentences.en: He had been a talented musician in his youth.
sentences.cn: 他年轻时很有音乐天才。

sentences.en: He is a very talented writer.
He was not only talented but immensely popular with his colleagues.
sentences.cn: 他不仅才华横溢，而且深受同事的喜爱。
他是个非常有天赋的舞者。

sentences.en: His recitals have earned him recognition as a talented performer.
sentences.cn: 他的演奏会使他赢得了天才演奏家的赞誉.
霍华德是个很有天分的钢琴家。

sentences.en: In February 1967, she began a dalliance with Robin Douglas - Home, 35, a talented and troubled pianist and the nephew of a former prime minister.
sentences.cn: 1967年2月, 玛格丽特与一位前首相的侄子、才华横溢但天性伤感的钢琴家35岁的罗宾·道格拉斯-霍姆开始了一段情缘.

sentences.en: She has a huge army of young fans, and is extremely talented.
sentences.cn: 她拥有一大批年轻的崇拜者，而且她极具天赋。

sentences.en: The annual competition has encouraged the emergence of several talented young musicians.
sentences.cn: 每年一度的比赛造就了若干卓越的年轻音乐家.

sentences.en: There is a sameness about all these tales . They're so stereotyped -- all about talented scholars and lovely ladies.
sentences.cn: 这些书就是一套子,左不过是些 才子佳人,最没趣儿.

sentences.en: They are inviting talented, but unheralded film-makers to submit examples of their work.
sentences.cn: 他们邀请有才气却尚未幸遇伯乐的电影制作人提交作品样本。

trans.tran_cn: 有才能的，有才干的，能干的
trans.tran_en: having a natural ability to do something well
